intro: Daphne bellojocensis, commonly known as the Bellojocensis Daphne, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features a woody stem with opposite, simple leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
